com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common.hsm.authentication

Class CryptoServiceAuthenticator<T,U extends AuthenticationCredentials,V extends KeyConfig>

  • com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common.hsm.authentication.CryptoServiceAuthenticator<T,U,V>

  • public class CryptoServiceAuthenticator<T,U extends AuthenticationCredentials,V extends KeyConfig>

    Class responsible for handling authentication of the cryptoService. Supports the ability to prompt the user for required credentials as well as resetting of the cryptoService authentication state once the desired tasks have been run.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CryptoServiceAuthenticator.GlobalCryptoLock
      A global lock object so only one thread can connect and authenticate with a crypto service at a time. This allows the crypto service interaction to complete with logOut so the isAuthenticated method doesn't return true in a different thread before the first thread has called logOut.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CryptoServiceAuthenticator(CryptoService<U,V> cryptoService, java.util.List<? extends T> credentialsConfigs, CredentialsTransformer<T,U> credentialsTransformer, NonExistentClass ctx_)
      Class responsible for handling authentication of the cryptoService. Supports the ability to prompt the user for required credentials as well as resetting of the cryptoService authentication state once the desired tasks have been run.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • CryptoServiceAuthenticator

        public CryptoServiceAuthenticator(CryptoService<U,V> cryptoService,
                                  java.util.List<? extends T> credentialsConfigs,
                                  CredentialsTransformer<T,U> credentialsTransformer,
                                  NonExistentClass ctx_)

        Class responsible for handling authentication of the cryptoService. Supports the ability to prompt the user for required credentials as well as resetting of the cryptoService authentication state once the desired tasks have been run.

        Parameters:
        cryptoService - crypto service used to execute the signing/key generation tasks.
        credentialsConfigs - list of authentication credentials configuration objects for the cryptoService.
        credentialsTransformer - transformer that converts each credentials config into a fully formed credentials object that can be used to authenticate the cryptoService.
        ctx_ - logging context for authentication operations
        cryptoService - crypto service used to execute the signing/key generation tasks.
        credentialsConfigs - list of authentication credentials configuration objects for the cryptoService.
        credentialsTransformer - transformer that converts each credentials config into a fully formed credentials object that can be used to authenticate the cryptoService.
        ctx_ - logging context for authentication operations

    • Method Detail

      • getCtx

        public NonExistentClass getCtx()

      • connectAndAuthenticate

        public <T> T connectAndAuthenticate(boolean headless,
                                    Renderer renderer,
                                    boolean logOff,
                                    NonExistentClass userInfo,
                                    Function1<? super com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common.cryptoservice.CryptoService<U,V>,? extends T> block)

        Interactively (using console) authenticates a user against the crypto service. Once authentication is successful the block is executed.

        Parameters:
        headless - indicate if user input is available, the authenticator will prompt for extra authentication input if it is not in headless mode.
        renderer - object responsible for handling of message rendering and reading of user input.
        block - to be executed once the authentication process succeeds.
        logOff - flag indicating whether the crypto service should log off should after block execution.

      • close

        public void close(Renderer renderer)
